characters: CHALLENGER AGAIN. HE RETIRED IN 1979. AFTER SHORT CAREERS
BROADCASTING AND BUDGIE BREEDING HE DIED OF A HEART ATTAC
EXT. SPANISH GP PADDOCK/ PARC FERME- DAY
AND AGAIN IN 1984. HE NOW RUNS A SUCCESSFUL COMMERCIAL
AIRLINE. HE STILL CLAIMS TO HAVE NO FRIENDS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark clouds passing overhead. The bad weather that has hovered over the Eifel mountains Germany), the past three days is on it's way out..

dialogues.speaker: AN EYE FLICKERS
dialogues.text: A pupil dilates and contracts in the light. The eye stare Blinks. Thinks. Making evaluations..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of sunshine break through. The voices of international TV commentators in different languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in places the track is still dangerously wet, but following a drivers meeting the decision has been taken. The race is going ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye belongs to a 27 year old Formula 1 RACING DRIVER wearing a fireproof balaclava... Highly intelligent, he also happens to be World Champion. name is painted on the side of his Ferrari. NIKI LAUDA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather always said history is cruel and reductive and no matter how long we live, or how much we achieve - we are remembered for very little. So make sure it's the right things. NIKI stares up at the clouds. His eyelids flicker. Thinki Agonizing. Wrestling with an all important decision... Is it going to carry on raining? Or become dry? Should he using slicks or wets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We widen to find ourselves on the starting grid of a majo Grand Prix. All around us...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Engines scream into life as DRIVERS start their cars. An OFFICIAL walks through the cars holding aloft a sign, "On Minute"... Deafening, angry thunder as engines rev impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. We have no control over our legacy. We cannot choose what we are remembered for... A Ferrari MECHANIC rushes towards NIKI, and shouts in Ita above the noise, (we see sub-titles)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mass usa slicks. Le vuoi cambiare anche tu? (Mass is going on slicks. You want to change?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI looks in his wing-mirror back to see a red McLaren, helmet, number 12, several rows behind him. A team of MECHANICS hastily changing the tyres to dry tyres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise I wouldn't be remembered for my rivalry with this asshole. And the 1976 season. NIKI then looks over at the car in pole position beside h Another McLaren, but with number 11, and a Union Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Hunt? Has he changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's going on wets. The car in pole position: JAMES HUNT, surrounded by TV cr mechanics, girlfriends, hangers-on.. The Maclaren team is less than half the size of Ferrari's HUNT makes up for this with magnetism. The rock star of F NIKI's face: a stab of envy seeing a flash of his rival's glamorous long blonde hair disappearing into his balaclav flirting with several hot-looking GIRLS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why it became such a big thing. We were just drivers. Busting each other's balls. To me this is perfectly normal. But other people saw it differently.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NIKI (contГ­d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That whatever it was between us went deeper. And changed us both somehow. Forever. NIKI stares, then... NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be, allora usiamo anche noi quells da bagnato. (Then we go on wets, too.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ten-second board is held up. NIKI pulls down his visor...as he and HUNT's eyes meet fo split-second, eyes staring... NIKI selects second gear for the wet track and revs the engine. The dashboard needle climbs through 8000, 9000, 1 RPM. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that explains the state of mind I was in. And why it happened. The other thing I'm remembered for. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On August 1st, that same year... CAPTION: "AUGUST 1st, 1976". The STARTER waves the flag. NIKI's foot hits the floor - engine screams that deafening, stomach rearranging high-p scream, drowning out the roar of the 180,000 crowd. NIKI's car is catapaulted forward violently, the wheel-sp leaving livid black scars on the asphalt.. NIKI gets away first. A good start! But within seconds th a McLaren car right behind him, breathing down his neck. His arch-rival. HUNT. But as the McLaren roars past, NIKI sees a white helmet. Number 12. It's not Hunt. It's MASS. On his bald, slick t NIKI curses under his breath. He screwed up. Made the wro decision. Should have gone on slicks. He urgently needs t change tyres... NIKI swerves angrily into the pits. Ferrari's pit is righ one end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commentary from all the world's TV stations explaining th crazy, panicked situation as all the DRIVERS come into th pits to change to dry tyres. It's chaos. A traffic jam of Formula 1 cars... The Ferrari team frantically work. Changing NIKI's tyres. men with air guns, two men with rapid-duty jacks. The sam Italian MECHANIC appears, `plugs in' his headset to the c MECHANIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair visto? Ti aveto detto di usare le slicks! (See? I told you to go on slicks!!) NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Where's Hunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! NIKI looks up to see the name JAMES HUNT written on the b helmet roar out of the pits ahead, with new tyres on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...!! NIKI screams at the MECHANICS, who are struggling. The ai make a high-pitched noise...something's not right. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's GOING ON??? "Thump", new (slick) tyres hit the tarmac, engines scream NIKI exit the pits in pursuit of HUNT. But the delay has him dear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archive TV commentary from the world's race COMMENTATORS stations informs us of the positions. MASS leading, HUNT in 3rd, LAUDA in 20th...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI gives it everything he's got. Tearing through the ge trying to catch JAMES HUNT, breaking as late as he can, e screaming.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He flies over the take-off hump between Pflanzgarten and Swallowtail - passes one car after another. Into 13th pla now. Pulling off outrageous manoeuvres. NIKI's P.O.V: the world flies past in a blur. The steerin wheel shakes. The car is right on the edge. Cannot be dri any harder. NIKI approaches the Streckenteil Adenauer-Brucke section the course...turns left at the Bergwerk corner. Crazy spe And tight. Too tight. A mistake... "Thump", his wheels come into contact with the kerb on th inside. NIKI tries to counter-steer, but is travelling at mph. The car jerks horribly to the right.. "Crunch", hits the embankment, then "Bang", hits the barr and is thrown across the track.. Fire breaks out in the engine. NIKI's eyes widen in horro with another car bearing down upon him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...! The oncoming car crashes head-on into our car, "Crash", a sickening, terrifying impact. The car explodes. Seventy litres of burning high-octane gasoline, with NIKI strapped inside, unable to undo his seatbelt. Locked in a blast furnace. NIKI screams as the flames engulf him. 800 degrees temperature. Trapped inside his car. Burning smoke fills his helmet, scarring his lungs... Pandemonium: commentary in different languages as panicke commentators helplessly describe what's happening.. NIKI's POV: he can just make out the barely recognizable figures of the other DRIVERS rushing towards NIKI.. Their hands get burnt in the flames as they try unsuccess to undo NIKI's seatbelt.. Fire extinguishers blast at the car. Dry powder extinguis Covering NIKI's helmet. Blurring his vision, as he cries in agony, inhaling the powder.. Screaming voices. Panicked reactions. On the side of the the painted name `Niki Lauda' blisters and melts.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then sound fades. As NIKI blacks out - losing consciousne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this: the sound of a ringing phone... 9   INT. HOSPITAL A&E UNIT - (ACCIDENT AND EMERGENCY) We're in a busy hospital A&E unit. Noise. Crowds. A r Saturday late afternoon. The phone continues to ring.. Finally, an attractive station NURSE in her 20's, run-off feet, breathlessly picks up the phone. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency... She covers her ears, straining to hear, listening to what being said. Then her expression changes... NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...standing by! The NURSE hangs up...then calls out to her NURSE and DOCT colleagues... NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the race-track..! There's been an accident..! A driver's been injured and is on his way in..! Instantly the atmosphere changes. A hive of activity as DOCTORS and NURSES prepare themselves for a major trauma. All PATIENTS with minor injuries are cleared out of the w The NURSE rings upstairs to the operating theatres and consultant surgeons, telling them to stand by...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: Swing doors open, and a pair of shoeless, BARE FEET walks through and into the accident and emergency unit. Camera tilts up a pair of long legs in white racing overalls...to reveal a tall, good-looking driver, JAMES H (mid 20's), tanned, athletic, surfer long blonde hair... A man about whom a word comes to mind one would rarely us describe an Englishman. SEXY. Blood trickles from his nose, there is bruising to his li the formation (already) of a nasty black eye, but make no mistake. He rocks. Drop-dead gorgeous..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the racetrack telephoned ahead that I was coming? Hunt? James Hunt..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES notices all the NURSES staring..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? No one seen a spot of blood before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10   INT. A&E UNIT - DAY The attractive NURSE is examining JAMES, opening his over checking for wounds, cuts and bruises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all thought you'd been in an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have. If you call a friendly disagreement with another driver an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you disagree about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business. Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's going to need a couple of stitches. It's a nasty cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a nasty blow. Done with a bloody spanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! Only what she begged me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NURSE notices bruising on JAMES's chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which was..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She examines him, testing his ribs for fractures, his che JAMES looks up. Their eyes meet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be happy to show you if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Crash', the door flies open as JAMES and the NURSE stumb through, mid-embrace, tearing at one another's clothes... The apartment is basic. Cramped. Messy. Like that of a po student. Ashtrays filled with half-smoked joints. Empty b cans. A toaster. A kettle. A stereo. A cage containing tw budgerigars. A mattress on the floor. Newspapers with headlines about the Dockers Strike, Engla crumbling economy, Rolls Royce being bailed out by the government - subtle reminders of Britain in transition, leaving behind its strong, imperial past. JAMES and the NURSE stand against the wall, still half- dressed, but already passionately making love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a theory why women like racing drivers. It's not because they respect what we do...driving round and round in circles. Mostly they think that's pathetic. And they're probably right.. (a beat) It's our closeness to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and the NURSE continue noisily, tirelessly making l in the shower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closer you are to death, the more alive you FEEL...the more alive you ARE. And they can see that in you. FEEL that in you. The way you live. Willing to risk everything.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES (V/O) (contГ­d) With no thought for tomorrow...as if each day is your last. It's a wonderful way to live...and the ONLY way to drive. The only way to get that tenth of a second on everyone else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovemaking becomes more intense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To dare to be one step bolder...one step faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is covered in perspiration, out on the edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure one step closer to death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and the NURSE, both screaming as they approach orga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one step closer to victory, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and the NURSE both climax together...and collapse o bed. Exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grotty old race track in South London. JAMES and the NURSE arrive at Crystal Palace race track i battered old mini. They get out. She looks up, seeing the mechanics, the racing teams, the cars..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been to a Grand Prix before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't. This is Formula 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lower division. Where people like me mess about in the hope of finding sponsors or being talent-spotted to race in Formula 1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES leads the NURSE into...

dialogues.speaker: THE PADDOCK
dialogues.text: The pits where JAMES introduces her to his team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, this is Nursie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gemma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nursie, this is Doc our designer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles, our chief mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Le Patron - Alexander, Lord Hesketh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thanks. Blimey...is everyone in Formula 3 this posh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass of champagne, Nursie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gemma. No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? It's Krug. Clos de Mesnil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's also ten in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. Superstar? You haven't brought us a bore, have you? JAMES strips off, changing into his racing overalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Nursie's anything BUT a bore..

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The NURSE, meanwhile, drifts over to look at the car wher BUBBLES is making last minute checks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her. The Dastle Mk 9...with the Lotus twin-cam sixteen hundred engine. She's no beauty. But goes like the clappers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd-looking car. A bit like a giant Go-kart, blue with yellow strips along the side and James's name in small letters. It looks small, dangerously fragile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uuuurrrrrkkkkkkggghghhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NURSE is shocked to hear a dreadful watery vomiting s She sees JAMES bent over behind the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to be worried about! Does it before every race! Good sign, actually. Means he's stoked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES continues vomiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lie that all drivers tell themselves. "Death is something that happens to other people." That's how you find the courage to get in the car in the first place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES emerges, wiping his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Superstar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never better, Patron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because bad things only happen to others, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a gargle with this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES takes a quick swig of the champagne...gargles, then swallows, puts on his balaclava...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem is deep down you know that's a lie. That it could happen to you at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick toke of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HESKETH passes over a joint, which JAMES inhales, taking huge lungful from....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you make that terror go away? Well, booze is good for that. And wacky baccy. But better than everything else is...sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES goes to the NURSE...and kisses her full on the lips then puts on his helmet, and athletically vaults into the JAMES hits the ignition, and a deafening high-pitched SCR as the engine starts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! What music! They could never have predicted it, those pioneers that invented the automobile that it would possess us like this, in our imaginations, our dreams. Nursie, men love women...but even more than that, men love CARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES notices another driver (NIKI LAUDA), his car alread unloaded, (number 35) and mechanics working on it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's new. Some German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (corrects) Austrian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a difference?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES looks over. On the side of the car, painted marking the form of a signature, "Niki Lauda".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All bloody Goosesteppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is neck and neck with NIKI. They go into a corner. NIKI gets there first. Up ahead though, approaching the s bend...JAMES sees the tiniest, slimmest crack to overtake right-minded driver would risk it. Only a suicidal maniac Which just happens to describe JAMES perfectly.. JAMES goes for it. Daringly. Brilliantly. And forces NIKI slam on his brakes to prevent a certain crash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HESKETH, BUBBLES, DOC and the NURSE watch from the sidelines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That move was suicide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was also quite brilliant!! God he's got balls!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES carries on driving. Flat out. But on the flat, NIKI suddenly comes out of nowhere. As i car has 50 bhp more. And overtakes JAMES. NIKI begins to pull away. And has th Englishman beaten.. JAMES sees red mist...and in an act of do-or-die vengeful madness, JAMES goes into a corner far too fast... ...yanks his steering wheel. And outrageously shunts NIKI car. An unforgivable act of unsportsmanlike vindictivenes NIKI and JAMES's cars both veer off...go into wild, letha spins..but luckily for JAMES he ends up facing the right way...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...and despite being badly shaken, dizzy, JAMES is able t change gears, and continue driving... NIKI's car, by contrast, has stalled...and now ends up fa THE WRONG WAY on the track... NIKI's eyes look up to see all the cars coming over a bro like a herd of Wildebeest, heading towards him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umgotteswillen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI rips open his seat-belt, is about to get out of his when one car shoots straight over the nose of his car. NIKI ducks, then bravely leaps for cover, as.... "SMASH", one of the oncoming cars shunts into his car, (i would have killed him instantly). "WHAM", another car narrowly misses him... "CRASH", another car forces NIKI into an evasive dive... Cars scream past him on all sides as the race continues.. NIKI, battered, shaken, has had an unbelievably close esc He rips off his helmet, furious... And now we see NIKI LAUDA's face for the first time. Shar featured. Intelligent eyes. Dark hair. Protruding teeth. Something unmistakably rat-like about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is on the podium, having won. He's with the NURSE, HESKETH and BUBBLES and his team, spraying them with champagne.. NIKI walks past the podium, holding his blue helmet, and shouts out, still incandescent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...asshole! That was my line! I had that corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the one you spun out of? And finished facing the other way? I think that corner had you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That move was total suicide. What if I hadn't braked? We'd have crashed..!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we didn't, did we? Thanks to your impeccable `survival' instincts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES makes chicken noises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Simon Wallis Hunt. Remember it, my little Jerry friend. Because one day he will be World Champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jawohl. Remember ze name. Very simple. "Hunt". It rhymes with....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "BEEEEP", a car horn hoots nearby, blocking out JAMES's c insult...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a word that happens to describe you perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter. NIKI gives JAMES the finger, "Screw you, asshol The NURSE watches NIKI go..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Chippy little Kraut. Bad loser. Forget him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI continues to walk off, middle finger raised..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To establish: the Austrian capital. OVER THIS: the sound NIKI's voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my home town, Vienna, my family is famous for one thing. Business. My grandfather was a businessman, my father, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is in front of a mirror, and dresses smartly in a ja and open necked shirt, evidently a little nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when they heard I wanted to race cars for a living, they had a few things to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, forbidding dining room. NIKI's FATHER and terrif GRANDFATHER, are eating supper. GRANDFATHER shakes his he clearly disapproves and barks in German...(we see subtitl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never! Racing is for playboys and dilettantes. Frivolous amateurs with nothing in their heads. The name `Lauda' appears on the front pages, with politicians and economists, not on the back pages with... (gestures in contempt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...footballers and skiers. If you want my money, you do as I say and follow me into my business.. NIKI stares at his GRANDFATHER..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in moments like this that you discover who you really are.. ...and in a move that he knows will rupture the family fo ever, NIKI gets to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Keep your money. Don't invest in me. But when I'm World Champion, and I have the trophy, and my name is not just on the back pages, but on the front too, you will regret it. NIKI walks out, the old man's insults ringing in his ears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dare sit at my table and lecture me on what I will or won't regret? Get out! Impertinent wretch! Consider yourself disowned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is in a meeting with visibly concerned BANKERS and LAWYERS. They speak in German...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another loan? Herr Lauda, you still haven't repaid the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totalling millions of Schillings. Plus your Grandfather called to inform us he will no longer be offering security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. There is no room for failure. I understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was still a Lauda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is driving his car. Beside him, is the attache case his lap. His car passes under a motorway sign reading "Flughafen". (Airport)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which meant I was still a businessman above everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private jet. A balding, blazered Englishman in late mid age (LOUIS STANLEY), owner of BRM racing, disembarks onto tarmac...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just so happens that the business I deal in is speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI sits with LOUIS STANLEY in an airport cafe. Contracts are open on the table. NIKI is signing. LOUIS STANLEY is counter-signing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In return for your money you get a car, mechanics and a place on the team. Plus fifty per cent of starting fees and bonuses for podium finishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the number one driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay Regazzoni and you will defer to him at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI takes out his cheque book and pen. He looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I defer to him if I am paying his wages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI writes the cheque. STANLEY's smile fades..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's a proven winner at the highest level, a good guy, and someone who quite frankly, could teach you a thing or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI ignores this, continues scrutinizing the contract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. There is one clause missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one about mechanics' exclusivity? Sorry. We have a cardinal rule at BRM. All information is shared between ALL our drivers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I made it perfectly clear that my mechanics work for me. No one else. This is something I cannot sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI takes back the cheque. STANLEY stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'll have the lawyers amend it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're at it you can tell them to amend the clause for podium finishes. Podium is first THREE places, not just wins.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NIKI puts the cheque in his attache case. Snaps it shut, taking it with him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get the money on signature, as agreed. See you at winter testing. NIKI gets to his feet, and leaves. STANLEY watches the at case disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that little git drives half as well as he negotiates, we're going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awards ceremony is in progress. The room is thick with cigar and cigarette smoke. A presenter on stage, wearing tie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm delighted to say the winner of the British Guild of Motoring Writers award for the `Most Promising Driver of the Year' is James Hunt... A loud, boisterous cheer goes up at the Hesketh Racing ta JAMES turns to a (new/different) girlfriend beside him, g her a lingering kiss on the lips, then gets to his feet, shakes hands with HESKETH, and BUBBLES and skips up to th podium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. My parents always wanted me to be a doctor, or stockbroker, and gave me a first class education...but to no avail. My brothers are the success stories. I get bored easily. I have a hot head, an inability to tolerate discipline. I fall out with people left and right. I'm quick to settle matters with my fists. The only creatures I've ever loved and treated well, are budgerigars. In any normal area of life, I'd be...or AM...a total liability. All I've got going for me is I'm quick in a car.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A good-looking woman calls out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So thank you for acknowledging that. And giving me this... (indicating trophy) I'm going to give it to my Dad, and tell him to put it on the mantle-piece and imagine it's a first class degree in medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afterwards: everyone is celebrating. Thanks to JAMES, eve pretty woman in the club is around. The trophy is perched beside bottles of champagne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Superstar. One more season in F2 then I'll move you up. To the big time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I'm ready now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are! I'm not! I've got to find you a car first. And the money. The economics of Formula 1 are terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up. You don't want him to do what Lauda did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Pop', HESKETH opens a bottle of champagne... BUBBLES (contГ­d) The Goosestepper. Remember him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES makes the chicken noises again..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he no longer wanted to risk his life with "a bunch of crazy amateurs and losers..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what he called us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing wrong with being an amateur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said if he was going to risk his life, he would only do so on the big roulette table. Formula 1. So he got himself a drive with BRM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? How? He never won a thing! Not a single bloody race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amateurs are what made this country great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took out a loan, apparently. Paid for it himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In war, as in lovemaking, amateurs are invariably better than professionals." Napoleon Bonaparte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stares. Already sick with envy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's either an act of utter lunacy, or the ballsiest thing I ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RECEPTION PAUL RICARD CIRCUIT
dialogues.text: The PAUL RICARD circuit near Marseilles in the South of France. Where all winter training and testing is done. NIKI arrives. An attractive woman (AGNES) greets him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki Lauda. Here for pre-season testing. BRM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat, please. I'll get someone to come and collect you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI watches as she telephones the BRM workshops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. There's someone here for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting) Lauda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misunderstanding, speaking louder) SOMEONE HERE TO SEE YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. NIKI decides against pointing out her mista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence. The RECEPTIONIST continues with her work. NIKI watches her, unsure what to say, (small-talk not his fort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worked here long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wondered if you've worked here long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost eight years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That long? And they didn't promote you yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, several times. I am the AGNES. Agnes Bonnet. If you're looking for the receptionist, she's on her lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is thrown. Feels humiliated. A total jerk. He is abo say something when the door opens, and... Two other F1 DRIVERS walk in..

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Glamorous, long-haired, tanned, fashionable - like rock s they talk effortlessly and flirt confidently with AGNES. What are you doing answering the phones? New haircut! Lik What have you done to the weather? They make her laugh. And smile. NIKI feels invisible. Embarrassed. Awkward. Inadequate. H gets to his feet. And goes to the car that has come to co him. As he goes, (unseen by NIKI), AGNES watches him. Ignoring other DRIVERS. Intrigued. He's different. Interesting. Intense. Intelligent eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up outside the workshops. NIKI gets out of car, and is greeted by LOUIS STANLEY, and the BRM team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki, let me introduce you to our number 1 driver, Clay Regazzoni..and our number 2, Jean Pierre Beltoise.. The intimidating, muscular, moustachioed figure of CLAY REGAZZONI, the Swiss driver. NIKI and CLAY shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are your mechanics, reporting exclusively to you. As per contract... REGAZZONI, BELTOISE and STANLEY exchange looks as NIKI sh hands, ad-libbed greetings with his MECHANICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see the car?

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BRM WORKSHOPS
dialogues.text: NIKI is led into the workshop to see a red and white Marl sponsored car, number 21, with a tall air-intake duct jus above the driver's helmet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. The P160..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as Regazzoni's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical in every detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI scrutinizes the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks heavy. How much does she weigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 540 kilos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. Why so heavy..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a 3 litre, V12 engine, that thing weighs 190k alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What horsepower are you getting out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough. Needs to be 500 and the engine needs to be 20k lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already tried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you use magnesium parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MECHANICS look at one another skeptically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting from above: The entire car has been stripped to a thousand pieces. No spread all over the workshop floor. NIKI's team of mechanics reluctantly work through the nig making the adjustments which NIKI is suggesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any solid plate, strip it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More disbelieving, skeptical looks. The car is in pieces the floor. NIKI brews coffee to keep people alert. Focuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when we've done that, we need to look at the aerodynamics. Front and rear wing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More mutinous looks. "Who is this asshole?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight breaks over the race-track. The doors to the wor open, and the MECHANICS and NIKI emerge - their work done NIKI goes to shake hands with the MECHANICS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thank you. Good night..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're exhausted. Refuse to shake hands with this nu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER: one of the BRM cars screams round the race-track.. NIKI watches on the sidelines as CLAY REGAZZONI is time- testing his car. He walks over to where LOUIS STANLEY and several MECHANICS are doing the timings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was his time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes six seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Now put him in my car, and he'll go round under two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six seconds faster? Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI looks up to see AGNES, the attractive TRACK MANAGER on the other side of the track. NIKI waves hi. AGNES waves back. Smiles. NIKI raises his eyebrow. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI gets into NIKI's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI races round the track at full speed. REGAZZONI roars past the finishing line in NIKI's car. LO STANLEY looks at the stop watch.. His expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANLEY comes into the workshop where NIKI and his MECHAN are in conversation, getting changed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. What did you do to the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's information I will share with you under certain conditions only. STANLEY stares, bracing himself..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guaranteed place in the team, and a paid contract on equal terms with Regazzoni for two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Clay's a senior figure in Formula One...you're a rookie. The only reason we took you ON was because you were paying us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as of now, if you want me to stay, we rip up the contract. I don't pay you a cent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he quicker in my car? He was, wasn't he? STANLEY stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he go under two minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) One fifty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have a think, work out your priorities, and get back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI turns, and goes. STANLEY stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even my WIFE speaks to me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY REGAZZONI emerges from testing his car. Still amazed the improved performance. Talking to his MECHANICS. In aw He removes his helmet, then stops. In the distance he sees NIKI talking to AGNES the attract TRACK MANAGER. They are clearly hitting it off..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is in the showers, then getting changed for his date AGNES. He is about to go, when he stops, and sees... CLAY REGAZZONI getting undressed, looking at NIKI. CLAY s English with an Italian accent..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're going to say. That it's none of my business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's the Track Manager you're taking on your date tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI immediately becomes defensive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but if you want my advice...I'd let this one go. I'm not questioning your taste. She's a great girl.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI (contГ­d) But Agnes's last boyfriend was a British Formula 2 driver, who has a reputation for two things. For being a suicidal jerk on the track, and for going all night, and all day afterwards...and all night again in bed. He's an OK driver, but an IMMORTAL fuck, apparently. I don't know about you, but that's not an act I'd like to follow. (shrugs) But if that doesn't bother you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? The driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt. James Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI stares. Can hardly believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? You share information, I share information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY slaps NIKI on his back, and goes into the showers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what team-mates are for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet/defeated) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A restaurant in Marseilles. Through the window we can see AGNES, the attractive TRACK MANAGER sitting at a table al Waiting for NIKI. Reverse angle to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is sitting in a car across the street. He stares at in the restaurant. Then starts his car, and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easton Neston. Set in 3,300 acres, one of England's great country houses. Home to the Fermor-Hesketh family since 1 JAMES and a new GIRLFRIEND drive up the gravel drive in h anything but grandiose Mini. It splutters to a stop, just time. They are greeted by uniformed STAFF who take his tatty ba from his filthy car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hesketh Racing workshops, situated in the converted stables on the estate. HESKETH leads a blindfolded JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep them closed...! Wait for it, wait for it... HESKETH removes JAMES's blindfold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! What do you say? JAMES opens his eyes to see a gorgeous F1 racing car, pla white, no stickers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she a beauty? The March 731. Converted by the brilliant Doc..! DOC POSTLETHWAITE takes a modest bow. JAMES shakes hands everyone, including his brother, (and manager), PETER..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a beauty. But...haven't you made a mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a Formula 2 car. She's F1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is, Superstar. Why? Because I got together with the beancounters, and it turns out that the economics of F1 are not so significantly different to the economics of Formula 2... BUBBLES clears his throat, dutifully bites his tongue..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we thought if we were going to be messing about losing money we might as well be doing it with the big boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been more serious in my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES embraces HESKETH in excitement, kisses him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I got the idea after what you said about the Austrian chap who bought his way in rather than waste his time in the lower divisions. I thought, "Bloody hell, he's right!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES slips into the cockpit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done the Goosestepper!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates car) No sponsorship, Superstar! I hope you approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, Patron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No vulgar logos for cigarettes, or condoms. Just plain white. With the Union Jack. And racing overalls which read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HESKETH indicates JAMES's hanging racing overalls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sex. Breakfast of Champions." Unless it's me, of course, in which case it's two kippers, porridge, boiled eggs, and half a dozen slices of toast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy! HESKETH pops champagne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't know what's hit them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To establish: a Formula 1 race track on Grand Prix week-e A helicopter comes in to land. The Hesketh Racing Team makes a grand entrance with a ret of BUTLERS, GIRLS, ROLLS' ROYCE's, oysters, champagne... A famous ex-champion TV REPORTER is there (Stirling Moss) providing skeptical commentary about Hesketh's debut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hard to tell whether Lord Hesketh and his team of upper class enthusiasts is bringing glamour to the racing community, or just comedy... They walk around in their own branded clothing. Alexander jacket reads, "Le Patron". He speaks to MOSS. Rolled eyes among other racing teams who express surprise curiosity (and frequently disapproval) at these new arriv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's certainly the first time I can remember seeing a butler serving caviar and oysters in the pits... Suddenly pandemonium breaks out. Screams. Something has happened. A bad accident on the track. During testing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding ear-piece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reports are reaching me of a serious accident that has just taken place in qualifying.... All smiles fade. The party atmosphere changes in a flash. Panic breaks out. The sound of sirens. Ambulances rushing to the scene of t accident. All the JOURNALISTS and TV CREWS rush off, too.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HESKETH, BUBBLES and JAMES look at one another, put down champagne glasses, and follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangled wreckage. A car has crashed into (badly installed Armco guard rails, splitting the railing in two... The DRIVER has been decapitated. His helmeted HEAD lies cleanly severed on the ground... A goldfish-bowl of blood. It's a horrific accident. People SCREAM and look away. Ev hardened medical professionals... JAMES, HESKETH, BUBBLES arrive on the scene of the accide But they are kept away, at a distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it seems the driver...just twenty- six years old....was killed on impact...and the death toll in Formula 1 shows no sign of slowing down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, dressed in his overalls, is violently retching. Si with nerves. A TV plays in the pits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in the last five years alone Formula 1 has lost Piers Courage, Jo Siffert, Peter Revson, Jochen Rindt, Francois Cevert, Roger Williamson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV: quickfire clips of the terrible, violent deaths. BUBBLES hastily switches off the TV as JAMES walks past..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES walks out of the paddock, towards his car. Other DR gathered in concerned groups, talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should cancel the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a distinctive Austrian accent..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? No one came to see him anyway. He made a mistake. Went into the corner too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? So says the nobody who had to pay for his own drive. How's that working out, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. How's it at the back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not planning on being there for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Look forward to you showing me the way today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Be happy to. I'll have you inside lap one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES walks off to his car, shaking his head..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI walks to his car, putting on his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is on the podium, spraying champagne. He is wearing victor's garland... Meanwhile: JAMES's car is embarrassingly being brought ba a tow-truck. NIKI watches from the podium.. His eyes meet JAMES's..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and BUBBLES and PETER HUNT (JAMES's blazer-wearing manager and elder brother), sit together at a table in th corner. It's late. A frank post-mortem. Drinking and talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki humiliated me today. He lapped me three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lapped Carlos Pace six times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's supposed to console me? What do I need to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Moneyman. `Didn't ask you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's right. You've got to change your attitude. We all do. And match it with a whole different mental approach. Professionalism. Maturity. Like Niki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet he doesn't go out every night, drink and screw himself stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So speaks the jealous married man..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. So speaks the manager who's wasting his time, making ten per cent of absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've just got to take it more seriously. Yourself more seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something he's never done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don`t patronize me, Pete...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you to spend less time in bars and nightclubs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that NO time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And more time with the mechanics, setting up the car. That's what Lauda does. 24 hours a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES rolls his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God knows there's nothing wrong with your talent. Or courage. It's purely a character issue right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the good news is I've got Sigmund Freud Horsely, failed driver par excellence, and a washed-up accountant to lecture me on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closes eyes) Jesus, James...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBLES walks off. PETER HUNT walks off. JAMES calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles? I'm sorry..! I didn't mean that! Come back..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand Hesketh estate in the Northamptonshire countrys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is in the workshops, his hands and arms filthy, he' been working on the car - but now his eyes are closed. Memorizing tracks. Around him people are working on the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....along the Beau Rivage, long left into Massenet, into the short right of Casino. Sharp right into Mirabeau, then sharp left into Loews, mind the guard rails...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Alexander around..? JAMES opens his eyes to see an endless pair of legs, a dr dead gorgeous figure, and the beautiful smiling face of S MILLER, the most successful model of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was. Then went to the house to take a call. He'll be back shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only he wanted to show off his pride and joy... SUZY indicates the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...rhymes with `boy' if you ask me. And `toy'. I can't believe what I'm seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so small! For something that costs so much. And so flimsy. There's no comfort. No protection. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just a little coffin, surrounded by high-octane fuel, being driven round at 170 miles per hour..

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES (contГ­d) (becoming grave) To all intents and purposes a bomb. On wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they make it safer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one wants it to be. It's like saying why not make bullfighting safer? It's a blood sport. The risk of death turns people on. Without it, I guess, it'd be half the fun. Which is fine for the voyeurs, fine for TV, fine for everyone.. (a beat) ...except us drivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZY looks JAMES up and down. Sees the bare feet, the roc star good looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're James, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought so. You fit the description. (shaking hands) Suzy. Friend of Alex's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background: one of the MECHANICS shows DOC a pictu SUZY from a tabloid newspaper. She's clearly the most fam model in Britain, and a star in her own right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the description?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly positive in terms of appearance. Negative only in terms of character. I've been told to avoid you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex. He says you're a bad boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was. Not any more. New me very professional. Early to bed. Early to rise. All very dull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round-the-clock work, practise and focus. Tedious, but apparently the only way to vin against ze Goosestepper..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you were doing when you came in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visualization techniques. Memorizing the circuit, in this case Monaco, which is next up. Eyes closed, know your way round in your sleep... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...I've always been a great believer in getting there on the day, putting the old foot down and playing chicken with everyone else. SUZY laughs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they don't want me to do that anymore...they want my body like a temple. My mind like Monk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your soul? Your heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be so disciplined in all areas of your life, can you..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to stop messing around, get married and settle down with the next nice girl I meet. They think it would be good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds bloody awful. SUZY laughs again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But since they're right about most things, they're probably right about that, too. JAMES looks SUZY up and down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't fancy getting married, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of ringing bells. London's grandest Catholic ch in the heart of Knightsbridge..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and SUZY, top hat and tails, flowing white wedding dress, looking ravishing, emerge from the church. JAMES and SUZY fall into a passionate, sexy embrace for t paparazzi cameras. Loud cheers go up, led by HESKETH and BUBBLES. They make their way to the waiting convoy of cars... On his way: JAMES spots a serious-faced HESKETH and DOC POSTLETHWAITE in conversation with some Formula 1 types i crowd.. SUZY is pulled away for photos. Clearly a bigger star eve than JAMES. JAMES turns to BUBBLES, indicates HESKETH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I don't want to ruin your day. BUBBLES stares, then reluctantly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems your revenge against the Goosestepper might have to wait a little longer than you'd hoped. (a beat) He's just been signed by Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT??? But that's the best team in the world. They could have ANYONE. Did he pay his way in there, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently they took back Regazzoni and he insisted they give Lauda a trial. Thinks he's a genius. Setting up the cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stares...then is pulled away to pose in photographs SUZY and her FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRARI's state-of-the-art practise facilities and privat test-track in Northern Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed circuit television, with 10 cameras and a complex timing system and computers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO FERRARI himself, the Commendatore, a formidable whit haired patriarch in Onassis dark glasses, reads newspaper sitting by the race tracks, barely looking up as two red Ferrari's roar round the track... LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO, the young, dynamic, aristocratic man of the Scuderia, by contrast, watches eagle-eyed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars stop, and NIKI and CLAY REGAZZONI gets out. talks (in a mix of Italian and English) to his MECHANIC, giving them typically blunt feedback...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrible! Drives like a pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshhh! You can't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Ferrari!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've driven better milk floats. It understeers like crazy and the weight distribution is a disaster... The MECHANIC gulps, then walks over to where the terrifyi COMMENDATORE and LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO are sitting, and pas on the information...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says the car is magnificent, a masterpiece, but he has suggestions for one or two minor refinements...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large press conference, with motoring JOURNALISTS and television CREWS from all over the world attending... ENZO FERRARI and LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO addresses the confer (in Italian) which is translated by a translator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are happy to welcome back to the Ferrari family our good friend, Clay Regazzoni...and also to introduce, from Austria Niki Lauda.. A burst of flash photography. NIKI and REGAZZONI sit side side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car drives fast on country roads in Northern Italy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY REGAZZONI is driving, NIKI is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ferrari Family". "Our good friend, Clay Regazzoni".

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI (contГ­d) You're friend and family to the Commendatore as long as you win. The minute you don't.. (mimes execution)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. It's business. I would be the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it isn't just business, is it? What we do? It's passion. Love. Which is why we're prepared to risk our lives for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. If I thought I had more talent and could earn better money doing something else, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do you know you will make money here? You haven't yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. But I will. (smiles) If you can, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI shakes his head, can't help smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, are you ever NOT an asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I an asshole? You know by now I'm both quicker than you and better at setting up the car. You can't deal with that, then you're the asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI pulls up outside the house... REGAZZONI (contГ­d) I brought you along today because you seem like a lonely kind of guy. I thought if I introduce you to some nice people, it'd be good for you. Forget it. Make your own friends.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REGAZZONI walks ahead, disappears through the front door, where he is warmly welcomed, and invited into a party. NIKI calls after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. C'mon, Clay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI stares through the window. Inside: a very appealing looking bunch - young, good-looking, cool, sexy GUESTS - having a good time.. By contrast: NIKI catches his own reflection in the glass reflection. Pale. Intense. The outsider. Inside: REGAZZONI is surrounded by friends, telling a sto Everyone laughs. NIKI watches. Then turns to walk away. As he goes, the fr door opens... And a beautiful dark-haired woman (MARLENE) emerges loadi several BAGS into a car. Brunette, tan. Wearing a white d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a lift to the nearest town? Anywhere with a train station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Nearest town is half an hour's drive. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives. The radio plays. Marlene sings along. NIK can't help noticing something. He turns down the music. MARLENE's smile fades..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that noise when you accelerate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your drive belt is loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alternator. And when you brake, your foot goes all the way down. Means there's air in the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Apart from the rear brakes are imbalanced. The front right wheel is flat, and it feels like a crack in the engine block...which explains why you're drifting so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God gave me an OK mind, but a really good ass, which can feel everything in a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're talking about. The car is fine. And it just had a service a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very good one. From a proper garage. It cost a fortune. This car is good as new. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White smoke pours from the engine. The car has broken dow Bonnet up. NIKI has tried fixing it, but to no avail. NIKI has a fan belt in his hand, but it's all but disintegrated under the heat of the over-worked engine. NIKI's hands are covered in oil. He is pushing a pen into large crack in the engine, slick with oil and grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing I can do here. The car needs a garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You're not in a hurry, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. As long as I'm back in Maranello by Monday morning. NIKI walks out into the road. Sticks out his thumb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you anyway? MARLENE breaks into GERMAN...(we see sub-titles)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're from Vienna, aren't you. We can speak German. How do you know Curd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Curd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curd Jurgens. The actor. It's his house. He is, or was until yesterday, my boyfriend. I must have been mad! There is something very attractive about an older man when they behave like one. But when they behave like a frightened child.. MARLENE gets to her feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let me do this. Otherwise we'll never get out of here. We're in Italy, after all. MARLENE indicates that NIKI should take a back seat, hitc up her skirt, showing long, tanned legs..

dialogues.speaker: SSSCCCREEEEEEEEECCCCCHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: Immediately a passing car screeches to a halt, then rever noisily to pull level. MARLENE smiles at NIKI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, eh? Three seconds. Admit it, you're impressed..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARLENE smiles flirtatiously at the handsome, young Itali MEN driving the open-topped sports car..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ciao, Regazzi...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Italian MEN walk right past her, not seeing her, she's invisible, and stare at NIKI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian) Excuse me...are you Niki Lauda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian) Oh, my God...!!! I told you it was him..!!! (blown away) Do you need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ITALIAN MAN gestures to his car, as his friend loads MARLENE's luggage inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An honour, please!!! But on one condition..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ITALIAN MAN whisper in NIKI's ear. MARLENE stares, no understanding, as NIKI protests, but then slowly, relucta gets into the car. He starts the engine. MARLENE watches as the ITALIAN MEN strap themselves in wi the seat-belts, tightening them...giggling like schoolboy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will someone please tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARLENE turns to NIKI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, anyway? What do you DO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know? He's a Formula I driver. Who just signed for Ferrari!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him? Never. Impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formula 1 drivers have long hair, are sexy, have shirts open to here.. MARLENE indicates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, look at the way he's driving!! Like an old man!! It's true. NIKI is driving in the slow lane. Like a pensi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to drive fast. It only increases the percentage of risk. We're not in a hurry. No one is paying me. Right now, with zero incentive or reward, why would I drive fast? MARLENE looks at him with her dark green eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm asking you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you always get what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually. NIKI stares, trying to resist...but cannot. He does a lightning double-declutch... "SLAM", NIKI's foot hits the floor, the engine screams, t rev counter flies to the right... And the open-topped sports car lurches into warp-drive...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARLENE is thrown back hard in her seat, "Jesus", her eye widen in terror and amazement..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...!! The ITALIAN MEN scream in excitement, holding on for dear as NIKI, his heart not a beat over 60, takes the car to breaking point, in a way it's never been driven before... NIKI overtakes everyone on the motorway, fearlessly weavi between cars at twice their speed.. We CLOSE on NIKI's eyes, remaining dead calm as his passe scream all around him, as he accelerates through the othe cars on the motorway... His EYES remain calm, his WHEELS a blur of speed, and we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm EYES, and WHEELS moving in a blur of speed. We're in middle of a Grand Prix, and NIKI is driving at the limit. CAPTION: "1975". Ahead of him: a familiar sight. The back of JAMES HUNT's Hesketh..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARLENE watches on TV in the pits as NIKI is engaged in a epic tussle with JAMES... Commentators note the improvement in JAMES's technique, maturity and performance. But then, "Puff", a plume of sm comes out of JAMES's engine. The engine has blown... Immediately JAMES loses speed, and NIKI sails past, overt effortlessly. Taking the chequered flag. Television commentary in various languages tells us: NIKI LAUDA has become world champion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's car pulls in, to be mobbed by jubilant MECHANICS a gets out of his car, removing his helmet, embraced by a delighted LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...then falling into a passionate kiss with MARLENE... Champion of the World, he is immediately swallowed up by REPORTERS who are demanding interviews in Italian, German English...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impromptu party in the paddock area. The victor's garl still round his neck, proudly holding the FIA World Champ trophy, his hair matted with champagne, NIKI passes throu the crowds, accepting everyone's congratulations.. He runs into JAMES, who's in bare feet as usual. MARLENE pulled away to talk to someone else..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though with a car like that, the rest of us never stood a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the fact the car is so good might have something to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still in a Ferrari. And I'm still in a Hesketh. On equal terms, the way it was in Formula 3, I'd beat you, and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. You might get lucky and win one race. Maybe two. Because you're aggressive. But in the long run, over the course of a season, no chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're not serious. You're just a party guy. Which is why everyone likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now try saying that and tell me you're not jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all that affection, all those smiles is also a sign of their disrespect! They don't fear you. Whereas compare that to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whom no one likes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even his own team-mates..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Because I'm relentless. I don't screw up. I go to bed early. I look after myself, look after my car. And then, soon as the race is finished, I go home. You should go home more often, too. I heard you got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In New York. Working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I've never seen you with her, once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI turns to MARLENE, "Let's go"..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES's Mini roars furiously up the long gravel driveway towards Easton Neston. Screeches to a halt. JAMES gets out of the car. Is greeted by staff, whom he uncharacteristically ignores, storming past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES walks into the workshops where BUBBLES HORSLEY is b doing something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, whatever it takes to beat Lauda, just say it, your word is my command. I'll do it. There are no lengths to which I will not go. And I mean it this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stops, noticing BUBBLES's expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then JAMES notices what BUBBLES is doing. He's packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then JAMES notices the lack of activity in the workshops. of the usual mechanics, or engineers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBLES looks up. Unsure how to break it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old drawing-room. The open fire roars. But HESKETH is uncharacteristically quiet. Defeated..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what the date is today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 14th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea of the significance of that date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm assuming it refers to some animal you are allowed or no longer allowed to slaughter on your estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's the deadline for securing sponsorship for the forthcoming Formula 1 season. (a beat) Which elapsed at midnight last night. And we didn't attract any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? We aren't looking for sponsorship. Condoms and cigarettes. Vulgar, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Except we are. Or were. I've made something of a miscalculation. The economics. Formula 1. Reality thereof. Turns out not like the lower divisions at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying it's over, Superstar. The banks have stepped in. Read me the riot act. Started laying everyone off. Probably have to sell this place. Fun while it lasted, would do it all again and all that... (ashen) I daren't tell you the actual figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stares at a devastated HESKETH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is on the phone to his brother PETER, while playing Scale-electrix cars on a track alone, barefoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a drive, Pete. Need you to find me a drive. (listens) What does that mean? "My reputation precedes me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Crash", the electric toy car crashes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listens) Really? Is that what they said? (a beat) Did they at least say a "Quick arsehole?" (listens) Bollocks to Lotus. Find me someone else. I'll go mad otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Click", JAMES hangs up. SUZY walks in. Sees his mood..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Something will turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES opens a bottle of Scotch, pours himself a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I doubt that will help in the meantime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES knocks back the drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go away for the week-end? Before I leave again for New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES carries on drinking..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, James. Don't make a stranger of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES doesn't react...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZY picks up her coat, and bag..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you hoping for? A well- adjusted knight in shining armour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No danger of that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go to men who are willing to kill themselves driving in circles looking for normality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I certainly didn't get that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have gone for one of my brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes that self-pity again. How striking it is -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Tell me..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
