dialogues.text: The gulf between appearance and reality. Look at you, all sunshine blonde beauty and smiles...yet the reality is...a frightened, immature, depressed, self-pitying child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least there's SOMETHING behind the facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a nasty temper..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off to New York, dear. There must be a moisturizer or eye shadow somewhere that needs your vapid mush to flog it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How quickly beauty can turn ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. Repellent. SUZY stares...and goes. JAMES carries on drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following morning. The phone rings. Piercing the dark JAMES, clearly the worse for wear, is talking to his belo budgies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good girl... A surprising vulnerability, and childlike innocence about JAMES. He strokes the birds with real tenderness.. The phone continues ringing. JAMES picks it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES listens, then hears something on the phone that mak him sit up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? McLaren?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is waking rapidly now..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get me in a room with them, Pete. Say anything. Today? Yes, I can do today. (checks watch) I can be there in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES starts scribbling down the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headquarters of McLaren Racing in Colnbrook, Bucks. A small, unassuming building on the Poyle Trading Estate. brickwork surrounds a brash yellow facade, with the words `MCLAREN RACING' in large white letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large boardroom. Team Director TEDDY MAYER (American, f Pennsylvania, short, lawyerly, 50's - hair turning grey) at the head of the table. Next to him is Aussie Marlboro spokesman JOHN HOGAN and McLaren Team Manager and chief mechanic ALASTAIR CALDWELL The atmosphere is tense, uncomfortable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come straight to the point. Our esteemed lead driver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitti-fucking-paldi..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has ditched us for another team at the last minute..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In November. Fucking outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we need a replacement. Asap. Thankfully a few hands have already gone up. Good people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Jackie Ickx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quicker than Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's consistent, dependable. Sponsor friendly. He'll dress up nice. Say the right things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? A driver or a brushes salesman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to be successful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. But I measure that in podium finishes and beating Niki Lauda not being a show pony for sponsors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard about this thing with Lauda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls eyes) Everyone has..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think you can beat him? He's World Champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beat him in Formula 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This season alone he's had eight podiums, five wins, you've had what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because I've been in the wrong car. I beat him when the playing field was level. I'd beat him again in a McLaren.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES (contГ­d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only car out there as good as the Ferrari. Which is why I'm here, begging. JAMES stares imploringly..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you ask. Even put on a suit, talk to sponsors and say the right thing. I promise. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the drive... CALDWELL, HOGAN and MAYER look at one another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots, to establish. South Africa in the aparthei era. We notice black race FANS unable to get into the tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...welcome to the Kyalami Racetrack where the big news is..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds flood to the spectator stands. The pit lane stretc into the distance, filled with cars, drivers and mechanic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that Britain's James Hunt in his first race for Mclaren has qualified fastest, beating Niki Lauda's Ferrari to pole by two hundredths of a second. In the crowds to watch the race none other than movie stars Richard Burton and Liz Taylor... We pick out RICHARD BURTON and LIZ TAYLOR waving to screa FANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI and JAMES's cars lined up in positions 1 and 2 on th starting grid. JAMES proudly indicates to NIKI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pole position. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed that, too. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level playing field now, my ratty little friend. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see where we are at the end of lap one. NIKI calls after JAMES as he walks to his car... NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see where we are in six races time!! JAMES turns, makes a ratty face at NIKI. Protruding teeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD BURTON and LIZ TAYLOR are shown into the VIP area the paddock. They take their seats. LIZ TAYLOR (bored already)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this take very long? An OFFICIAL introduces BURTON to various people - among t SUZY HUNT... OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Burton...Suzy Miller, also known as Mrs. James Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? There it is. The deep, dark, sonorous Welsh baritone voice...scarred by alcohol and cigarettes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Hunt. One of the racers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Richard. (extending hand) Also known as Mr. Elizabeth Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates LIZ who is deeply bored..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does a girl have to do to get a drink around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZY smiles. Their eyes meet. And no eyes are more beauti than SUZY's. An immediate connection between them. Their hands hold a fraction too long as they shake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's car roars past the finishing line first. JAMES clo behind...

dialogues.speaker: 104AEXT. PODIUM
dialogues.text: JAMES and NIKI are on the podium together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My car wasn't right today. Next time I'll have you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES's car takes the chequered flag, finishing first!!!

dialogues.speaker: 108AINT/EXT. MCLAREN PITS
dialogues.text: In the pits: TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL and JOHN HOGA leap to their feet in delight. Punching the air. Victory.

dialogues.speaker: 108BEXT. SPANISH GRAND PRIX PODIUM/ PITLANE
dialogues.text: Afterwards: JAMES and NIKI are on the podium together... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? Car fixed. Equal terms. You'd better get used to this. JAMES walks off, to celebrate with the McLaren team... NIKI stares darkly - threatened - watching JAMES go.. ...then goes to talk to LUCA DE MONTEZEMOLO and the FERRA team. CAPTION: "...BUT IS THEN DISQUALIFIED".

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPANISH GP PADDOCK/ PARC FERME- DAY
dialogues.text: A huge furore as several OFFICIALS and FERRARI TEAM MEMBE and TV CREWS surround JAMES's car... Raised voices debating the width of the car, HUNT furious people almost coming to blows... OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is too wide.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five eighths of an inch..! OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which makes it illegal! If you want to compete, you have to change it. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You can't just `change it'. That means rebuilding the car. Who lodged the complaint? It was Ferrari, wasn't it? The two rival PIT CREWS, (McLaren and Ferrari), scream ab at one another in Italian and English - a highly charged explosive atmosphere....

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NIKI watches from the inside of the FERRARI TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The McLaren MECHANICS, supervised by Alastair Caldwell, a making adjustments to the car to make it `legal'..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we have to move the wing forward. To make it legal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that'll have a knock-on effect on the oil coolers.. JAMES watches - already fearing the worst - as the car is stripped down, effectively being rebuilt...

dialogues.speaker: 111AEXT. WATKINS GLEN 1976
dialogues.text: "BANG", JAMES's car shudders violently, the wheels shake the drive shaft snaps...

dialogues.speaker: 111BEXT. MONACO GRAND PRIX 1976- DAY
dialogues.text: "BOOM", a loud explosion. A thick plume of black smoke bi from the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: 111CEXT. BELGIUM GP 1976
dialogues.text: "CRASH" - JAMES spins out...and a tyre bounces along the track...JAMES's car has crashed into a wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand it... The tyre continues bouncing, people diving out of it's pa before the tyre finally smashes into a hot-dog stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES storms back into the pits, screaming at MAYER, CALD and the MECHANICS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened? What have you DONE?? The car's evil! It's undriveable..!

dialogues.speaker: 113AINT. PADDOCK/PRESS TENT
dialogues.text: Later: the victorious NIKI, wearing the garland, is all smiles, giving `winner' interviews, surrounded by MARLENE a delighted LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO. JAMES is also giving interviews, but in a total fury. Vibrating with anger. Still complaining about the disqualification. Complaining about a conspiracy. Complai NIKI finishes talking to JOURNALISTS, and walks off, thro crowds, and bumps into JAMES..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...six races in. How's it going so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! Just got a little problem with a bad loser rat and his team of Italian saboteurs who've destroyed my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won that race in Spain. And you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an illegal car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aerofoil was five eighths of an inch too long!! Something that doesn't have the slightest effect on car speed. You complained. Now we've had to totally rebuild the car and it's become a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least it's a LEGAL monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car that was beating you week in week out, so you have to resort to this. Cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives in an illegal car and he calls ME the cheat? Let me tell you: two weeks before that race in Spain, we put 20-inch rims on the rear wheels. We get an extra half second speed on each lap!! But the Old Man tells me we can't use those rims, they make the car too wide. Against the rules. So we go back to 19-inch rims making the car slower again. Rules are rules. For all of us. You're just a bad loser who can't accept that. (tapping head, to MARLENE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Komm, he's crazy. Sick in the head. NIKI turns to MARLENE, speaks in German...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Den Trottel lassen wir alleine.. (Let's go. Leave this jerk alone.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder she left him... NIKI and MARLENE go. JAMES is left staring. Not understan

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ZOLDER PADDOCK/ MCLAREN TRUCK
dialogues.text: JAMES walks into the crowded MCLAREN pits. Sees TEDDY MAY and ALASTAIR CALDWELL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I should know about Suzy? Where is she? Wasn't she supposed to be here today? CALDWELL nervously indicates the Sunday newspapers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kept it from you. Didn't want to tell you before the race... JAMES looks at the newspapers, then his expression change

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lurid headlines about SUZY HUNT in New York with RICHARD BURTON. Pictures all over the front pages of RICHARD BURT ELIZABETH TAYLOR, SUZY and JAMES. JAMES's face falls..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jumbo jet roars down the runway and takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmistakable skyline. Among the ten thousand craggy rooftops and skyscrapers... A grand, five-star hotel overlooking Central Park in Manhattan's mid-town district...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge collection of paparazzi SNAPPERS and Journalist HA is camped outside the hotel. Immediately a surge of activity, "Here he is"... A burst of flashlights and a volley of questions from the JOURNALISTS as JAMES - gets out of the taxi and runs the gauntlet of humiliation... ...into the hotel..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large hotel suite. There are flowers everywhere. Newspa are all over the table. JAMES sits opposite SUZY. He sees an expensive gift; rece opened. A diamond necklace..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That from him? SUZY nods. Even the uninitiated eye can tell: it's worth fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you come here, James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want me back...you never wanted to be married in the first place. You did it because you hoped it might change you...settle you down... help with the racing. Not because you loved me. And who knows, if it had been just the drinking, or the dope, or the infidelity, or the moods...it might even have worked...but when it's all of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not terrible. You're just...who you are...at this point in your life. And God help anyone that wants more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be able to give you more? He has quite the bad boy reputation himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's important is how it feels to me. And it feels like he adores me. A flicker behind JAMES's eyes. Failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's aware of the delicacy of the situation, and how it looks. Having raided your larder. Plundered your safe. Smash and grab, and so forth. So he's assured me he'll take care of the financial side. And will be very generous. JAMES manages a brave smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll give him a call.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUZY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. His lawyers will contact you. JAMES notices the vast unmade bed. Where, until recently, people had slept.

dialogues.speaker: 121AEXT. HOTEL
dialogues.text: JAMES emerges from the hotel - into the storm of paparazz again. He manages a brave smile... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all very amicable. My wife has found herself a new backer...I mean lover...which makes her happy.. (laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Burton has found a way of feeling young again...let's hope his pockets are deep...they'll need to be... (laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've found a way to be single again without it costing me a penny, which has to go down as the biggest win of my career. Laughter from the JOURNALISTS who are hungrily writing do the copy. But JAMES's hollow smile fools no one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES sits alone in the first class section. A loser on t track, and a loser in love, too. Being played out in the glare of publicity. On the front pages. Being read by eve on the plane. A STEWARDESS looks over, catches his eye. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and the STEWARDESS fucking. Hard. Nothing to do with pleasure. An analgesic - a way of bloc out the pain. JAMES catches his own reflection in the mir Teeth clenched. Eyes burning with anger and self-loathing OVER THIS: we fade in the ROAR of car engines...

dialogues.speaker: 123AINT. FRENCH GP 1976
dialogues.text: JAMES's teeth still clenched. Eyes still burning with ang Driving flat out. At the limit.

dialogues.speaker: 123ACONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suzy's words still ringing in his ears. Make that beyond the limit. At the point of no return. Th shaking. Weaving recklessly through other cars... Where death has become a real option. Because he doesn't care anymore. Because it's all he dese anyway... And in that moment, in reaching his lowest point, JAMES h unwittingly stumbled on the one thing that gives him an advantage over everyone else... The fact that he doesn't care. The fact that death has be an option. The fact that there is no risk he is not prepa to take... So every corner is tighter, every braking point later, ev gap is an opening, no matter how tiny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chequered flag waves as JAMES's car roars across the finish line... JAMES screams with released rage.... CAPTION: "RACE 7. HUNT WINS. LAUDA's ENGINE BLOWS UP"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afterwards: TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL and JOHN HOGAN celebrate in delight...cheering...

dialogues.speaker: 126AEXT. BRITISH GRAND PRIX
dialogues.text: NIKI's car is pursued by JAMES's. They disappear behind a copse of trees. Out of sight. When they re-emerge, JAMES is ahead of NIKI, having overt him - to the delight of the partisan crowd. The chequered flag waves again as JAMES's car roars acros finish line... CAPTION: "RACE 8. HUNT WINS. LAUDA 2nd." JAMES screams in catharsis and triumph. Teeth clenched. E wide and staring with concentration.

dialogues.speaker: 126ACONTINUED
dialogues.text: We notice SCREAMING GIRL FANS cheering him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blazer-wearing FIA OFFICIAL addresses a room full of sp and motoring JOURNALISTS, TV CREWS, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following an inquiry into the disqualification of driver James Hunt from the Spanish Grand Prix, it has been decided to overturn this disqualification...and to restore his victory, and reinstate his points..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, TEDDY MAYER, ALASTAIR CALDWELL, and all the MECHAN are watching on TV... Huge celebrations. Cheering and whooping. SCREAMING GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded PRESS room. In opposite corners of the room, JA and NIKI are giving interviews to different PRESS and TV journalists. Stirling Moss is talking to JAMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...James, a few weeks ago, you were out of the running for this season completely, now you're right back in it. What's changed...? Screaming GIRLS in the background, shouting "James, we lo you." JAMES stares across the room at NIKI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combination of factors, not all of which I'm prepared to discuss here. Justice being done re: the disqualification in Spain helps, and having my old car back of course... In the other corner: NIKI is doing his interviews in Germ (we see sub-titles)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathematically in theory it's now possible for Hunt to catch you. Are you worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. For him to catch me, he'd have to win all the remaining races, and I'd have to lose them. And pigs would have to fly. Laughter among the confident GERMANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I have a private family matter to attend to. NIKI takes MARLENE's hand, and leads her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To establish: the Viennese skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI and MARLENE get married. In stark contrast to JAMES' wedding...it's a small, intimate affair. Modest. Not show Away from the cameras. Just them. And a witness from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small aeroplane takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI and an INSTRUCTOR are in the plane. In the cockpit. MARLENE, who watches... NIKI is learning to fly. MARLENE watches as NIKI soaks up the instruction, asking questions, happy. It's another side to him, completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI and MARLENE in a pool. In Ibiza. Playing. Laughing. Honeymooning. Then NIKI's expression changes. His smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARLENE is fast asleep. She wakes, to discover the bed is empty beside her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARLENE walks through the house, looking for NIKI. Then f him on a balcony...alone.. MARLENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to bed. MARLENE notices his mood. It's different. MARLENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the enemy, you know. Happiness. NIKI looks up at MARLENE... NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It weakens you. Puts doubt in your mind. Because all of a sudden you have something to lose.. MARLENE stares at him. MARLENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you call happiness an enemy, then it's too late. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have lost already. MARLENE turns, and goes.. NIKI is left alone. We can tell from his expression, he i struggling with something for the first time. Fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The notoriously difficult and treacherous German race tra Testing is underway. A CAR (from one of the other teams) skids, and crashes violently.

dialogues.speaker: 139AEXT. NURBURGRING
dialogues.text: AMBULANCES arrive. The Driver is badly hurt. Screaming in pain. His leg is crushed. Bone is sticking out. A brutal compound fracture. He is taken away.

dialogues.speaker: 139BINT/EXT. NURBURGRING PITLANE
dialogues.text: In the pits, everyone is shaken. JAMES, REGAZZONI, and ot DRIVERS nervously talk among themselves as the Ambulance past. NIKI's face: visibly pale. More frightened than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Race-day. Huge crowds arrive at the Nurburgring. And rain Heavy rain falling. Television commentary informs us about the Nurburgring's terrible reputation as a `graveyard' track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES arrives at the race track, to find ALASTAIR CALDWEL waiting for him, a concerned look on his face... CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've just been told, a driver's meeting has been called. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who by? CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki. JAMES's face. Instantly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About sixty people, (26 DRIVERS and all the different tea REPRESENTATIVES), are assembled in the room, where a blaz FIA OFFICIAL and a member of the DRIVERS SAFETY COMMITTEE sitting behind a table... A buzz of anticipation and curiosity. What's going on? Wh all this about? NIKI gets to his feet, raises his hands calling for silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I called this meeting because as all drivers know the Nurburgring is a race track from the Stone Ages. The most stupid, barbaric, outdated, dangerous, track in the world. You've all seen the rain which has been falling this morning. Those of you with experience know the Ring needs perfect conditions to be even remotely acceptable in terms of risk. As you can see today is anything BUT perfect, so I called this meeting to take a vote to cancel the race. A ripple of astonished reactions among the drivers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There would be no change to the situation as far as points is concerned. The race would simply be cancelled. TEDDY MAYER looks over at FERRARI representatives....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit... Another DRIVER (GUY EDWARDS) gets to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the race is cancelled, none of us get our race fees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. You leave without your fee, but you might leave with your LIFE. Another voice pierces the controversy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It also means you would effectively win the championship. It's JAMES HUNT, who is standing up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can see why this suits you just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? There would be no points for me either...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there would be one race less where I, or anyone else, could catch you. Uproar in the room... BRETT LUNGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is right! This is just tactics! ARTURO MERZARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferrari's dirty tricks! We've seen it before! HARALD ERTL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just that he's frightened? Laughter among the DRIVERS... NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which asshole said this? Silence. No hand goes up. No one has the courage to own u NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am frightened. Always a little bit when I race. I accept every time I get in my car there is 20% chance that I could die. But not one per cent more. And today, with the rain the risk IS more. How dare you accuse me of lack of courage? Let me remind you. I have the track record here. I am the only person in history to do the Ring in under 7 minutes. So actually it's to my ADVANTAGE to race here today. Because I'm quicker than all of you. A stunned silence. One voice pierces the room... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then let's race! It's JAMES who stares at NIKI: a ripple of excitement and enthusiasm among the other drivers... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hundred thousand fans out there who would never forgive us if we didn't. MERZARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some of us need our race fees!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FIA OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those in favour of cancelling the race? NIKI puts his hand up. One or two other racers, too... FIA OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those in favour of racing? JAMES puts his hand up. Clearly the more popular, charism figure among the DRIVERS, everyone else follows. FIA OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, start your engines!! A clear victory for JAMES. He has swung the room. Everyone leaves the room. JAMES and TEDDY MAYER give one another a discreet hi-five... But we rack focus through the crowd to see NIKI staring a JAMES accusingly...holding his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "RRRROAAAR", an explosion of noise, as we widen and find ourselves on the starting grid of the German Grand Prix. An OFFICIAL walks through the cars holding aloft a sign, Minute"... Deafening, angry thunder, as cars rev their engines.

dialogues.speaker: 143AAN EYE FLICKERS
dialogues.text: A pupil dilates and contracts in the light. The eye stare Blinks. Thinks. Making evaluations..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the eye belongs to JAMES. He stares up at the clouds. His eyelids flicker. Thinking. Agonizing. Wrestling with all important decision... Is it going to carry on raining? Or become dry? ALASTAIR CALDWELL comes up to JAMES, and shouts above the noise - no time to plug his headset in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jochen's going on slicks. You want to change? JAMES looks in his wing-mirror back to his colleague, JOC MASS's car, number 12, several rows behind him. White helmet. A team of Mclaren MECHANICS hastily changin tyres to bald, dry tyres - ('slicks'). Then JAMES looks o at the car beside him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Niki changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's going on wets. NIKI's car: surrounded by Italian Ferrari MECHANICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we go on wets, too. JAMES pulls down his visor...as he and NIKI's eyes meet f split-second, then... The STARTER waves the flag. They're off! JAMES's foot hits the floor - his engine screams at almos 9,000 rpms, drowning out the roar of the 180,000 crowd. T car is catapaulted forward, the wheel-spin leaving livid scars on the asphalt.. JAMES and NIKI both make good starts, and are neck and ne but within seconds there's a McLaren right behind them, gaining fast. JAMES realizes it's his team-mate, JOCHEN MASS in a white helmet. Number 12. On his slick tyres. MASS was right to gamble on the track drying out. JAMES c under his breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...! JAMES screwed up. Made the wrong decision. He urgently ne to change tyres. With barely one lap completed... He swerves angrily into the pits..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commentary from all the world's TV stations explaining th crazy, panicked situation as JAMES comes into the pits to change to dry tyres. The McLaren team frantically changes the tyres. Four men air guns, two men with rapid-duty jacks. ALASTAIR CALDWELL appears, talks to JAMES.. CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I told you to go on slicks!! You didn't take my advice... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Where's Niki? CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind you! He made the same mistake! JAMES looks in his mirror to see NIKI's red helmet behind in the pits, then... "Thump", new (slick) tyres hit the tarmac. JAMES gets the signal, `Clear!' CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go!! Go!! JAMES's foot hits the floor. He roars out, with new tyres leaving NIKI behind him in the pits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archive commentary: from the world's TV stations informs that JAMES roars up into 3rd position..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES gives it everything he's got. Tearing through the g breaking as late as he can, engine screaming. The world flies past in a blur. The steering wheel shakes car cannot be driven any harder. No thought for safety. N thought of failure.. Failure is unimaginable. Unconscionable. He turns into the final straight, then stops when he sees something ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Flags. Red flags. RACE MARSHALLS. Something has clearly happened. An accident.. The race is being stopped. JAMES brakes, slowing down. He pulls level with a uniformed MARSHALL..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accident. Bad one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's POV: a continuation of the opening scene. Burning fills NIKI's helmet, burning his lungs. He cries out in a

dialogues.speaker: AAAAARRRRGHGHGGHGH
dialogues.text: We can just make out the barely recognizable figures of t other DRIVERS rushing towards him, as their hands get bur the flames as they try unsuccessfully to undo his seatbel We notice it is the same DRIVERS that were critical of NI the driver's meeting. HARALD ERTL, BRETT LUNGER, ARTURO MERZARIO, GUY EDWARDS... Fire extinguishers blast at the car. Covering NIKI's helm Filling his lungs with chemicals, along with the smoke an fumes, blurring his vision, as he screams horribly.. The sound of panicked TV COMMENTARY in different language Screaming voices. Panicked reactions. Then sound fades. As NIKI blacks out - losing consciousne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER THIS: the hypnotic sound of helicopter blades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 1st, 1976, I discovered comas exist for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's POV: the door to a helicopter opens, as it arrives Mannheim University Hospital... The sound of shouting voices. Hospital STAFF pull reach towards NIKI, pull his stretcher out. NIKI's internal voice groans: cries out at the pain. NIKI (V/O)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things are better not remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Crash", doors burst open and NIKI is rushed into emergen Neon ceiling lights pass overhead... The sound of difficult breathing. His stretcher is surrounded by DOCTORS, talking urgently, making quick assessments.. NIKI's POV: fading in and out of consciousness. Bursts of concerned, urgent, overlapping dialogue among t German DOCTORS which NIKI can barely make out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two narrow, barely open slits of light. NIKI's swollen ey lids. NIKI's POV: barely making out MARLENE standing besi the senior burns specialist DOCTOR. NIKI hears voices... DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the burns to his face that are the danger. It's the burns to his lungs. His blood oxygen level is currently... NURSE
DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is not enough to maintain life... NIKI slips out of consciousness again. MARLENE is distrau in tears.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION NEWS
dialogues.text: TV news: giving the latest information on NIKI's conditio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES sits watching the news on TV in his apartment, whil feeding his budgerigars, (the collection has grown).. He feels terrible. He goes to his desk, pulls out paper a pen... JAMES tries to find the right words, tries to write, trie put his feelings on paper, but words in general, and lett in particular have never been his thing... JAMES scrunches up the pieces of paper, throws it away. T budgerigars, sensing his distress, flutter and peep..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's P.O.V: feels someone touching his forehead and his hands with oil...and the sound of a WOMAN weeping... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...durch diese heilige Salbung helfe dir der Herr in seinem reichen Erbarmen, er stehe dir bei mit der Kraft des Heiligen Geistes... NIKI's eyes barely crack open, barely manage to focus to an ELDERLY PRIEST is giving him the last rites in German. The sound of MARLENE crying somewhere in the room. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Der Herr der dich von Sunden befreit, rette dich in seiner Gnade richte er dich auf... NIKI strains to move. A sense of excruciating pain. He fights to open his eyes, give an indication...ANY indication of the fact that he is hearing this, and is al and able to fight for life... But to no avail. The PRIEST continues giving last rites. MARLENE continues to cry. The PRIEST touches NIKI's shoulder... NIKI (V/O)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here! Can't you tell? I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NIKI screams inside. Wanting to be heard. Wanting to give a sign. He's OK. He's still there. But it's no use. NIKI blacks out again. The pain is too great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunrise: MARLENE has been sitting in the hospital all nig supported by members of FAMILY and several FRIENDS. Niki's MOTHER and FATHER. CLAY REGAZZONI. Presently: the door to the intensive care unit opens and DOCTOR comes out, beckoning her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frau Lauda? Bitte kommen Sie! He's awake! And just spoke! MARLENE scrambles to her feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tell the Priest to fuck off! I'm still alive!!" MARLENE covers her mouth, laughs nervously, already in te She and the DOCTOR rush into the intensive care unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting through the window we see MARLENE approach NIKI' bed. She sees NIKI.. And gasps. Trying to control her expression. Not give awa him how horrified she is. NIKI's face: is grotesque. His head has swollen to double size. The skin has burned off on his head, his eyes. MARLENE bravely composes herself. Then, without displayin shock she feels - she goes over and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starter's flag drops. On television we see the Austri Grand Prix start. NIKI watches the race on television, while beginning his in bed, in pain as bandages are changed.. ON TV: JAMES narrowly misses out on a podium, but still g on NIKI in his points total... CAPTION: "RACE 11. HUNT FINISHES 4th"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI continues his rehab in the hospital, now out of bed. ON TV: the starter's flag drops. Another Grand Prix start This time at Zandvoort, in the Netherlands.. NIKI watches the race on television as DOCTORS put a vacu pump into his lungs. It's AGONY. JAMES leads, driving the perfect race... YOUNG GERMAN DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to vacuum the lungs. Without this, they can't heal. But it will hurt. An unimaginably painful pump is forced down his burned lu to try to hoover out the impurities.. COMMENTATORS ON TV: talk about how HUNT is catching up wi LAUDA on points. It spurs NIKI on, through gritted teeth. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaarrrggghhhh... The chequered flag. JAMES crosses the line in first posit

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: The DOCTORS tell NIKI he's had enough vacuum treatment. H had more than enough pain. But NIKI waves them aside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again!! The DOCTOR nods. The vacuum is turned on again. NIKI screams in agony. Eyes bulging. MARLENE and NIKI's f cannot bear to watch...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He watches as ON TV: JAMES is on the victory podium spray champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI continues screaming in pain, watching the Canadian G TV as..

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: For the first time, JAMES has taken the lead in points. N stares at the TV: his expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI screams again. MARLENE, NIKI's family and the DOCTOR deeply distressed, cannot bring themselves to watch, as..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaarrrrggghghhhhhh!! We WIDEN to reveal what NIKI is doing. What has caused th unbearable, bloodcurdling screams of agony..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're all thinking... Now we see. With great difficulty NIKI has put his racing helmet on for the first time. Pressing into his open burn wounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you love me - all of you - you won't say a word. He is almost unconscious with pain. His legs are weak. Bu has done it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italian Grand Prix. TELEVISION COMMENTARY sets the sc JAMES and the MCLAREN TEAM arrive in the pits to see a va commotion going on elsewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's Niki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here! He's racing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?? They said he was half-dead. JAMES stares. Shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES pushes through the pitlanes, until he reaches the crowded FERRARI pits. He sees a racer in the background. name LAUDA on his overalls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki? NIKI turns round. JAMES sets eyes on him for the first ti JAMES reels, visibly horrified by his appearance. His ban are blood stained. He has no hair. Looks grotesque.. NIKI sees the horror in JAMES's face. Sees the shock. The horror. And recognizes in that moment, this is how it's g to be - this is how people will respond to him - forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. It's that bad, huh? JAMES opens his mouth. Tries to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hospital I told them to tell me straight, no bullshit - how bad it would be. My appearance. They said with time it'd be fine. But it won't. I can tell, seeing your reaction. I am going to spend the rest of my life with a face that frightens people. NIKI stares at JAMES, at his rival's beauty, his blonde, tanned perfection. His matinee idol, movie star looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a tough one to get used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote you a letter at the time. To apologize. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES (contГ­d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's meeting in Germany? Before the race? I swayed the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That race should never have gone ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in some ways...I feel responsible for what happened. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, watching you win those points and all those races while I was in hospital fighting for my life...you were equally responsible for getting me better. Ouch. That could have been meant generously. But in this it wasn't. It was a cold slap in the face. NIKI turns and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed press conference. The world's media. NIKI's acci and recovery (as a story) has reached way beyond F1 race This is front page news around the globe.. NIKI walks out onto the podium - all eyes staring at him sense of a ghoulish, voyeuristic freak show.... NIKI sits on the podium, in front of microphones, flanked both sides by FERRARI drivers and top brass. But no one w to talk to them. Everyone's here to talk to NIKI..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Niki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you confirm for us exactly which procedures you have had? And the expectations for your recovery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I had a skin graft operation where they put half my right thigh in my face. It doesn't look too good but one unexpected advantage is it's impossible to perspire through a skin graft, so sweat will never run in my eyes again - which is good for a driver. Laughter. At the back of the hall, JAMES HUNT creeps in, (unseen by anyone, disguised in a hat), to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they heard about your condition, Ferrari immediately hired another driver, Carlos Reutemann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ja. Before even my first operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he your replacement now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just another team-mate. Keen to make an impression. So let's see where Mr. Reutemann finishes today. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Hunt and McLaren have caught up a lot while you were away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a question now? Or are you just trying to piss me off? Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can still win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I have the better car. I'm the better driver. But he's a clever guy and has used the time well while I was lying half-dead in hospital to win some points.. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did your wife say when she saw your face? NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said, "Sweetie, you don't need a face to drive. Only a right foot." Laughter. BRITISH JOURNALIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being serious. Do you really think your marriage can survive? With the way you look now? Silence. NIKI squints into the lights.. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm being serious, too. Which asshole said this? Jesus.. No one moves. NIKI, disgusted, rips off his microphone.. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Press conference over. NIKI walks out. The Press Conference breaks up... JAMES sees the REPORTER who asked the question, laughing his friends. JAMES watches as the REPORTER leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES goes after the REPORTER, and calls him.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey..! The REPORTER turns, recognizes JAMES.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something for you on that last question... The BRITISH JOURNALIST smiles, "Great, thanks James!" Pul out a tape recorder. JAMES takes him to one side, then... "WHACK, WHACK, WHACK" - JAMES punches his lights out, the takes the tape recorder, stuffs it into the JOURNALISTS m JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go home to your wife and ask her how YOU look!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: "CRASH" a final, sickening blow splits the REPORTER's nos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES walks out to his car. TV CREWS. Banks of PHOTOGRAPH Commentators talk in different languages. Everyone talking about NIKI's comeback. NIKI is in his car. The MECHANICS are talking to him in Italian... But NIKI hears nothing. He looks at the steering wheel, t shell of the car, the gear stick. And then we see.. His hands are shaking violently. He's utterly terrified. The light turns green. They're off! Other cars (including JAMES's), roar forward. But NIKI is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's mind is a mess - terrified - he starts slowly...fi his courage.. COMMENTATORS point out it's madness. It was clearly too s Ferrari were right to hire a replacement. NIKI is a wreck NIKI suffers terrible flashbacks from his accident... NIKI shakes himself out...gradually building up speed - ignoring the cars overtaking him all around him... NIKI begins to accelerate. Gently at first. Then a bit mo Trusting himself. Gaining confidence.. Blocking out further flashbacks...

dialogues.speaker: 170AINT. HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Watching NIKI from the hospital where he had his treatmen the DOCTOR who treated him...

dialogues.speaker: 170BEXT. TRACK
dialogues.text: COMMENTATORS look up. Notice NIKI's slow increase in spee What's this? Maybe there's life in him yet... NIKI changes gears smoothly. He begins to overtake. The o feelings come back..

dialogues.speaker: 170CEXT. PADDOCK/PITS
dialogues.text: MARLENE watches from the pits. Can hardly bring herself t look...

dialogues.speaker: 170DEXT. TRACK
dialogues.text: COMMENTATORS begin to get excited. LAUDA has started to overtake the back-markers... An incredible sequence. As NIKI gains more confidence, mo speed, and begins to work his way through the field.. COMMENTATORS now buzzing with excitement. This is incredi as NIKI overtakes first CARLOS REUTEMANN, the driver hire replace him, then others, working his way through the fie

dialogues.speaker: 170EINT. JAMES'S CAR
dialogues.text: JAMES sees NIKI coming up behind him. Cannot believe his JAMES move to block NIKI's path... NIKI attacks fearlessly. Despite terrible pain. NIKI move overtake JAMES. Utterly intimidated by NIKI's bravery, JAMES panics, and control of the car. He spins out.. COMMENTATORS cannot believe their eyes. HUNT's blown it! LAUDA's overtaken him! It's a miracle. It defies belief. As NIKI crosses the lin CAPTION: "RACE 15. NIKI 4th. JAMES RETIRED."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italian crowds are ecstatic. Delirious. NIKI is a nat hero. Lazarus back from the dead. Superhuman.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TV commentary in different languages elaborates on what a extraordinary, superhuman achievement they have just seen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a race! What a man! What a season! Now it all boils down to the final race in Japan! Hunt walks past, staring at a triumphant Niki.

dialogues.speaker: 172AINT. HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: The DOCTOR in the hospital shakes his head, cannot believ what he has just witnessed...

dialogues.speaker: 172BEXT. PITS
dialogues.text: The Ferrari Mechanics that had initially so disliked NIKI overwhelmed by what he has achieved...

dialogues.speaker: 172CEXT. TRACK
dialogues.text: A reluctant, modest NIKI carried on shoulders, surrounded LUCA DI MONTEZEMOLO, MARLENE and the PRESS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mount Fuji towers imperiously, dramatically above the Jap race track, dominating the skyline on a clear day.. Television cameras and press photographers assemble at th race track for the biggest sporting event of the year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES sits alone in his hotel suite. Speaking to an old, trusted friend at the other end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man was in a coma. His doctors pronounced him dead!! Then he comes back and does THAT???

dialogues.speaker: 174AINT. BUBBLES HORSELY HOME
dialogues.text: BUBBLES HORSLEY back at home in England. At a breakfast table.. BUBBLES (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect? That Niki would give you the championship lying down? Of course not. He's a fighter. He's going to come at you with everything he's got. But you can do this. As a driver, you're his equal - better, maybe. And God knows you're quick and brave enough. You just.. JAMES (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BUBBLES (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to find the respect for yourself to close out when it really matters. You don't much like yourself, James - that's the problem, therefore don't believe you deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: 174BINT. JAMES'S HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: A knock at JAMES's hotel room door.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. JAMES hangs up, and goes to the door. He snaps it open to reveal.. Two gorgeous-looking BOAC Stewardesses standing outside. blue blazers, short skirts, white gloves, blue caps.. STEWARDESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. We've come for the party? JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party we were told was going on in room 2109. Sure enough: on JAMES's door, the number 2109. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sent you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man. On the phone. He didn't give his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man. Did he speak with an accent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. German accent. JAMES can't believe it. NIKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it was a joke..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (liking the look of JAMES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwww. Pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ladies. Any other time. Not tonight. JAMES closes the door. Goes back into his hotel room. The after a moment... He snaps open the door. The STEWARDESSES are about to disappear into the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following morning, day barely breaks. The skies are ominously dark over Tokyo. Thick, black clouds. It's raining heavily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI wakes up and looks out of the window. Sees the heavy which is falling outside... His expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES wakes up. Flinches. JAMES looks around, bleary-eyed Hungover. He's in a room that looks like a bomb has hit it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The two STEWARDESSES are still asleep in the bed beside h Uniforms discarded on the floor. Memories are now flooding back. Jesus, what was he THINKI JAMES leaps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI is being massaged by WILLI DUNGL in his hotel room i preparation for the race. NIKI continues to stare out of the window. They speak in German. We see sub-titles..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locals here believe if you can see the mountain in the morning, it brings good luck. NIKI's POV: the view. Nothing but mist, dark skies and ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the race track: puddles everywhere. The rain conti to fall. The circuit is covered in water... DRIVERS and the TEAMS arrive at the race track. JAMES and TEDDY MAYER and ALASTAIR CALDWELL among them... SPECTATORS are huddled under umbrellas. TV CREWS struggle keep expensive equipment dry... An American VOICE comes over the tannoy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All drivers to the control tower, please. Immediately. JAMES looks at CALDWELL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A driver's meeting has been called. All the DRIVERS are i small room, arguing and remonstrating with FIA OFFICIALS blazer-wearing POWERS THAT BE... A Japanese official, (AKIYAMA), is trying to keep the pea AKIYAMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One at a time! Gentlemen, please! Local JAPANESE DRIVERS are complaining in Japanese, (we s sub-titles)... TAKAHARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't send us out in that! It's a death sentence! HASEMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to postpone the race!

dialogues.speaker: 181AINT. CONTROL TOWER
dialogues.text: JAMES, MAYER and CALDWELL arrive in a corridor outside th meeting room... MAYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki's talking to them about cancelling the race. JAMES's POV: he can see NIKI, his wounds horribly visible remonstrating with the JAPANESE OFFICIAL about the danger track conditions... JAMES turns to TEDDY and ALASTAIR... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any part of this. I'm not going to be responsible for turning the room again. CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have no option. You HAVE to race, James. It's your only shot. If you don't, Niki wins.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not voting against Niki again....or forcing fellow drivers to risk their lives. Sorry. World Championship or not... JAMES raises his hands and walks off. CALDWELL shouts aft him, "James, wait..!" Then MAYER reassures CALDWELL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, this race is going ahead. The TV rights have been sold all around the world. MAYER can see that a vote is taking place in the room. Ma the drivers have their hands in the air, voting... The JAPANESE OFFICIAL is struggling to keep order in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drivers can vote all they like. A round of applause in the room, as the DRIVERS vote to c the race. But unseen by the DRIVERS.. The FIA OFFICIALS, TV NETWORK EXECUTIVES, and the blazere POWERS THAT BE are in dark, conspiratorial discussion.. ...making the decision that the race goes ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIVE TELEVISION FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: NEWSCASTERS from all over the world, in several different languages, announce that a decision has been made.. The JAPANESE Grand Prix is definitely going ahead. The dr have been called to the starting grid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pits alongside JAMES... A series of shots of the other DRIVERS...being sent out l lambs to the slaughter... Visibly terrified, mouthing prayers, smoking last cigaret meditating, crossing themselves, hands shaking.. Among them the JAPANESE DRIVERS. All laughter gone now. Realizing what they've got into. Risking their lives. Finally we come to rest on NIKI. Strangely calm. NIKI puts on his balaclava over his still-raw wounds, win with pain as he puts on his helmet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is piggy-backed to his car by MECHANICS so his feet don't get soaked in the water pooling deep on the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES lowers himself into a car with puddles on the seat. straps himself in. ALISTAIR CALDWELL approaches with a power-drill. Leans to JAMES, with the screaming drill... CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep still... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing??? `ZZZZ", "ZZZZ", "ZZZZ", CALDWELL drill holes in JAMES's v CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To let the condensation out. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it will also let the water in. CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you're leading. CALDWELL stares at JAMES... CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. This race is all about the start. Whoever's in front will see everything. Whoever's second... CALDWELL gestures, "Nothing"..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. They shake hands. JAMES starts the engine with a roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI's engine replies with a loud roar. He looks over at JAMES. JAMES turns to face NIKI.. ALL SOUND GOES SILENT... ...as JAMES and NIKI stare at one another. All around the the world slows down. Comes to a standstill.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR EYES MEET...
dialogues.text: A connection between them. Unspoken realization of where have both got to. What this moment means. For them both.. It's what they have been waiting for. Working towards. Al this time. NIKI raises his hand. In a gesture only JAMES sees. JAMES raises his in return. A private salute. Chivalric. From a bygone era. And in that moment, enemies become brothers. Two men. Risking their lives. THE TEN SECOND FLAG IS RAISED.. The moment's truce is broken. They return to the task at THE FLAG DROPS. THEY'RE OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNT's foot hits the floor. NIKI's foot hits the floor... JAMES gets the better start. His car aquaplanes like craz skating over the water, totally out of control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALDWELL and MAYER watch from the pit wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold onto it, James..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miraculously JAMES steadies the car... The spray from his wheels creates a curtain of mist. The cars are wrapped inside it... But JAMES has a clear view ahead. He slams his foot down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the perfect start for Hunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKI can see nothing. Surrounded by spray, water, noise.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Other cars are spinning all around him. It's chaos. NIKI bravely accelerates into blindness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lauda's car is right on his tail! Barely visible in the spray..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES goes to a corner, then his car twitches, aquaplanes again...badly...almost losing it completely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt turns too tightly! He almost lost his car right there...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBLES HORSLEY, ALEXANDER HESKETH and a number of the characters from the Hesketh Racing days are all watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate, Superstar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES struggles to hold onto his car. He steadies it, maintaining the lead.

dialogues.speaker: 194AINT. NIKI'S CAR
dialogues.text: JAMES's spray makes it impossible for NIKI to see. NIKI c blink his eyes...it's agony. Half-blind, NIKI tries to overtake. Gives it everything h got, breaking as late as he can, tearing through the gear For NIKI the world flies past in a near-blind blur. The steering wheel shakes. The car cannot be driven any harde But the visibility is terrible. The spray tears into his scarred eyes. He is unable to see anything but... MARLENE's beautiful face: staring at him. Smiling tenderl Kissing him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES continues to race flat out. Engine screaming. Foot the floor. His car aquaplanes again...almost skidding out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZY HUNT is watching on television as RICHARD BURTON tal the background on the telephone... SUZY (urging him on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, James...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign is held up as JAMES races. Lap 39. But there are problems with the car. One of the tyres... CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God! His front tyre! Look! It's completely frayed! CALDWELL and TEDDY MAYER watch in horror from the pits an TV. They can see the shaking car.. COMMENTATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt's car has problems...it's shaking...the Englishman is definitely getting slower...

dialogues.speaker: 199AEXT. PITS
dialogues.text: ALASTAIR CALDWELL holds up a sign.... CHANGE TYRE COMMENTATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with just a few laps to go, McLaren are calling for Hunt to come into the pits to change tyres... JAMES's car roars past the pits, refusing to stop... COMMENTATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hunt is refusing! Simply ignoring his team's orders...! He's made the calculation that he can still hold onto the lead...!

dialogues.speaker: 199BINT. EASTON NESTON
dialogues.text: HESKETH and BUBBLES cover their eyes. Can't look... BUBBLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!! What are you doing??? HESKETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't bear it!

dialogues.speaker: 199CINT. JAMES'S CAR
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a Ferrari in JAMES's wing mirror. Unmistakably, in the spray, he can see the distinctive RED HELMET... It's NIKI. JAMES's blood runs cold... JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! NO!!!! JAMES tries to fend NIKI off. Swerves this way and that. his wounded car is now running at seventy per cent at bes ...and disaster!!! NIKI OVERTAKES HIM... JAMES screams in agony and frustration. He's lost it! And no one to blame but himself! His own arrogance. And stubbornness. NIKI's overtaken him! THE CHEQUERED FLAG. JAMES roars past. Has finished in third place. But that i consolation. NIKI has beaten him. As far as he's concerne JAMES has lost. Lost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES's car arrives in the pits. In a fury. At himself. F refusing to listen. What a disgrace. What shame. What a f But he is engulfed. JAMES gets out of his car, raging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! But TEDDY MAYER is celebrating wildly. ALASTAIR CALDWELL, The world's media descends on JAMES... MAYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?? What are you talking about?? You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You WON!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish!! What about Niki?? He overtook me!! I saw it!! A Ferrari with a red helmet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't Niki. That was Regazzoni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki withdrew. Said it was too dangerous, refused to drive!! (gestures)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Champion of the World, kiddo! TEDDY MAYER takes JAMES's number `11' from the side of hi car, and tears it in two, leaving number `1'. JAMES's face: as he realizes. Then explodes with happines

dialogues.speaker: 200AINT. EASTON NESTON
dialogues.text: HESKETH and BUBBLES cheer in celebration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it! He bloody well did it!

dialogues.speaker: 200BINT. HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: A television plays in the Emergency Ward of the hospital. NURSIE catches sight of the victory, patients cheering an applauding... NURSIE allows herself a smile.

dialogues.speaker: 200CINT. HOTEL
dialogues.text: BURTON is at the door in tuxedo, waiting to go. SUZY, dre glamorously, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, James.. Then turns the TV off. And follows BURTON out.

dialogues.speaker: 200DEXT. JAPAN GRAND PRIX
dialogues.text: JAMES is embraced by CALDWELL and MAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the race-track, the sound of helicopter blades tur JAMES looks over to see... NIKI in the helicopter with MARLENE and a PILOT. NIKI, no ex-World Champion, looks over to see a triumphant JAMES surrounded by press, McLaren colleagues, etc MARLENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK? NIKI turns, takes MARLENE's hand as he answers. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. It's just one race. The helicopter lifts into the air, and flies off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES watches as the helicopter carrying NIKI flies away, turns to see... ...the world's press begins to descend on him, and the bi party of JAMES HUNT's life is about to begin.. In the background, the two JAPANESE DRIVERS are giving interviews again. They didn't just survive, MASAHIRO HASE got the fastest lap of the race, and NORITAKE TAKAHARA ca 9th... And at that moment, magically, the sun breaks through, an snowy peak of Mount Fuji is finally revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of newspaper headlines, television talk shows, lucrative endorsements, TV commercials, sponsorship, public billboa JAMES's world championship victory has made him a rich ma His movie star looks make him an international STAR and marketing man's dream. Girls, more girls, and even more girls.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES, dashing in a white suit, plays trumpet on the UK's famous talk show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the runway of an airport in Northern Italy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: A stretch limousine pulls up on the tarmac. A still-drunk JAMES HUNT and several good-looking WOMEN, FRIENDS (and hangers-on) spill out of the limo... They cross the tarmac towards their waiting private jet, passing other jets, when JAMES stops. He's seen something that has caught his eye. JAMES sends his FRIENDS on ahead to their waiting jet, an walks over to a small private jet, (a Learjet 35)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you were spending more and more time in one of these... A hunched PILOT doing final checks. The figure turns. It' NIKI. His wounds have healed a little, but it's still a painful sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try it. If something goes wrong up there, you're on the edge, but have to stay within the rules. Stick to regulations. Suppress the ego. It's good discipline for the racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there I was thinking you were about to wax lyrical about the romance of flight. I should have known better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES indicates his rowdy, cool-looking friends..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend's wedding. At least I think it was a wedding. Might have been a birthday. All a bit of a blur. How about you? Been at Fiorano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-season testing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already? In February? You're relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I meant it as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is one. Relentlessness is good. Means you're a fighter. That you never give up. Behind my back I know some of you guys call me `The Rat.' Because I look like one. It's meant as an insult. But I don't mind it. Rats are ugly, sure. And no one likes them. But they're intelligent. With a strong survival instinct. JAMES can't help smiling. That's NIKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do you start testing? Next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad? I didn't just win the biggest thing of my life so I could get right back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You need to. To prove to all the people who will always say you only won it because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because what...? Because of your accident? Is that other people, Niki? Or you? I won. On the all important day when it came down to it, we raced on equal terms in equally good cars.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JAMES (contГ­d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bottled and I had the guts to see it through. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. You won that race. And believe me if I had to lose that title to anyone, I'm happy it was you. But that doesn't change the fact you have to win again. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's what it means to be a winner, no? It's a permanent condition. Never stops or goes away. It stays with you always. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's winning? Sounds like losing to me. Some of life needs to be for pleasure, Niki. What's the use of having a million cups and medals if you never have any fun? How is that winning? The plane load of JAMES's friends call out..."C'mon, Jame NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I could learn from you. In hospital the toughest part of my treatment was the vacuum. Pumping the shit out of my lungs. It was agony. While doing it, I was watching television...you winning all those races...and I was cursing you.. "That bastard, Hunt", I would shout, "I hate that guy." one day the doctor said, "Mr. Lauda, may I offer one piece of advice? Stop thinking of it as a curse to have been given an enemy in life. It can be a blessing, too." I said, "Who are you, Confucius?" He said, "A wise man gets more from his enemies than a fool from his friends." And you know, he's right. Look at us. We were a pair of kids when we first met. Hotheaded jerks in Formula 3. Headed nowhere. Now we're both Champions of the world. Not bad. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not bad.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't let me down now. I need you busting my balls. Get back to work. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Niki. But I intend to enjoy myself first. And so should you. You think you can? NIKI stares. A blank look.. JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you on race day, Champ. NIKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Champ. JAMES goes. NIKI watches him, pulled into his plane by hi laughing, cool FRIENDS. An unmistakable flicker of envy i eyes. Then NIKI turns, alone, and resumes his safety checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES's plane roars down the runway and takes off into th azure blue sky...

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE. HE STILL CLAIMS TO HAVE NO FRIENDS."
dialogues.text: The End
